eu.fbk.dkm.internal.util

Class Algebra

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.internal.util.Algebra

  • public final class Algebra
extends Object
    Utility methods pertaining to Sesame query and update algebra.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Algebra.ExcludeReadingGraphsVisitor
      Helper class supporting the rewriting of TupleExpr so to prevent reading from graphs whose URIs match a certain prefix.

      • clone

        public static org.openrdf.query.impl.DatasetImpl clone(@Nullable
                                       org.openrdf.query.Dataset dataset)
        Clones the supplied dataset, returning a modifiable copy. The returned dataset has the same default graphs, named graphs, default insert graph and default remove graphs as the supplied dataset.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset to clone
        Returns:
        a modifiable clone of the supplied dataset, or null if the supplied dataset was null

      • clone

        public static <T extends org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode> T clone(T root,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           IdentityHashMap<org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode,org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode> sourceToCopyMap,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           IdentityHashMap<org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode,org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode> copyToSourceMap)
        Clones the supplied algebraic tree, optionally keeping track of the association between original and cloned nodes. Note that associations must be stored in IdentityHashMaps, as the implementation of equals and hashCode for algebraic nodes is expensive as recursive and for some nodes broken (e.g. Count node).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of root node for the original and cloned trees
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the tree to clone
        sourceToCopyMap - an optional map where associations original node => cloned node are stored
        copyToSourceMap - an optional map where associations cloned node => original node are stored
        Returns:
        the root of the cloned tree

      • findPropertyPathRoot

        @Nullable
public static org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr findPropertyPathRoot(org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode childNode)
        Finds the root node of a property path, starting from a child node of that path.
        Parameters:
        childNode - the child node where to start searching from
        Returns:
        the root node of the property path, if there is such a path, or null if the child node does not belong to a property path

      • findGroupPatternRoot

        @Nullable
public static org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr findGroupPatternRoot(org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode childNode)
        Finds the root node of a group pattern, starting from a child node of that pattern. A group pattern is a sub-tree composed only of Join and StatementPattern nodes, plus ValueExpr nodes linked to that nodes (e.g., variables).
        Parameters:
        childNode - the child node where to start searching from
        Returns:
        the root node of the group pattern comprising the specified child node, if any, otherwise null

      • replaceNode

        public static org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode replaceNode(org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode root,
                                                   org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode current,
                                                   org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode replacement)
        Replaces a node in an algebraic tree, returning the root of the modified tree. Note the root changes if the node to be replaced was the root of the tree.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the tree the node to replace belongs to
        current - the node to replace
        replacement - the replacement node
        Returns:
        the root of the modified tree, possibly different from the supplied root

      • insertFilter

        public static org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode insertFilter(org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode root,
                                                    org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr filteredNode,
                                                    org.openrdf.query.algebra.ValueExpr filterCondition)
        Inserts or modifies a Filter node before the node supplied, enforcing the condition specified and returning the root of the modified tree. If a filter node is already present, its condition is put in and with the supplied condition.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the tree the node to filter belongs to
        filteredNode - the node to be filtered
        filterCondition - the condition to enforce in the added (or existing) Filter node
        Returns:
        the root of the modified tree, different from the original root if that was equal to the node to filter

      • extractVariables

        public static Set<String> extractVariables(org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode expr)
        Return a set with the name of variables mentioned in the algebraic expression specified. More precisely, the method searches for all nodes of type Var which are not associated to a value.
        Parameters:
        expr - the expression from which variables should be extracted
        Returns:
        an immutable set with the extracted variables

      • isTrivial

        public static boolean isTrivial(org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode expression,
                @Nullable
                org.openrdf.query.Dataset dataset)
        Checks whether the supplied algebraic expression is trivial, i.e., it produces no query results or update modifications. Evaluation of a expression detected as trivial can be safely skipped. The method operates on a best effort basis and it may be possible that a trivial query is not detected as such. The following criteria are applied:
        • a TupleExpr is trivial if it can't read from any graph;
        • an InsertData or DeleteData is trivial if it inserts or deletes nothing;
        • a Modify is trivial if its where part has no matches or if it deletes or insert nothing;
        Note that Clear, Add, Copy and Move expressions are always not trivial
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to check
        dataset - the optional dataset associated to the expression
        Returns:
        true if the expression is trivial

      • rewriteDefaultContext

        public static <T extends org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode> Map.Entry<T,org.openrdf.query.Dataset> rewriteDefaultContext(T expr,
                                                                                                                @Nullable
                                                                                                                org.openrdf.query.Dataset dataset,
                                                                                                                org.openrdf.model.URI replacement)
        Rewrites the supplied update expression in order to re-target read and write access to Sesame null context to a replacement context.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of expression to rewrite
        Parameters:
        expr - the expression to rewrite
        dataset - the optional dataset associated to the expression
        replacement - the replacement graph
        Returns:
        a key-value pair whose key is the rewritten expression, and value is the rewritten dataset; note that both the expression and the dataset are rewritten only if necessary, reusing the original objects otherwise

        private static org.openrdf.query.Dataset rewriteDefaultContext(@Nullable

                                              org.openrdf.model.URI replacement,

      • replaceIfNull

        private static org.openrdf.query.algebra.ValueConstant replaceIfNull(org.openrdf.query.algebra.ValueConstant constant,
                                                    org.openrdf.model.URI replacement)
        Helper method that generates a new ValueConstant for a replacement graph if the supplied ValueConstant is null, meaning it denotes the default graph.
        Parameters:
        constant - the current ValueConstant
        replacement - the URI of the replacement graph
        Returns:
        either the supplied ValueConstant, if not null, i.e., denoting the default graph, or a new ValueConstant for the replacement graph supplied

      • excludeReadingGraphs

        @Nullable
public static Map.Entry<org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode,org.openrdf.query.Dataset> excludeReadingGraphs(URIPrefix prefix,
                                                                                                          org.openrdf.query.algebra.QueryModelNode expr,
                                                                                                          @Nullable
                                                                                                          org.openrdf.query.Dataset dataset)
        Rewrites an algebraic expression and/or its associated dataset in order to prevent reading from graphs whose URIs matches the supplied prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix of graphs for which reading must be prevented
        expr - the expression to rewrite
        dataset - the optional dataset associated to the expression
        Returns:
        null if the rewritten expression is trivial, otherwise a key-value pair whose key is the rewritten expression, and value is the rewritten dataset; note that both the expression and dataset are rewritten only if necessary, reusing the supplied objects otherwise

      • excludeWritingGraphs

        @Nullable
public static Map.Entry<org.openrdf.query.algebra.UpdateExpr,org.openrdf.query.Dataset> excludeWritingGraphs(URIPrefix prefix,
                                                                                                      org.openrdf.query.algebra.UpdateExpr expr,
                                                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                                                      org.openrdf.query.Dataset dataset)
        Rewrites an update expression and/or its associated dataset in order to prevent modifying the content of graphs whose URIs matches the supplied prefix. NOTE: Modify expression with more than one unbound context variable in INSERT or DELETE clauses that are assigned to URIs matching the pattern, are rewritten in a way that may prevent also writing of statements to graphs not matching the prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix of graphs for which writing must be prevented
        expr - the update expression to rewrite
        dataset - the optional dataset associated to the expression
        Returns:
        null if the rewritten expression is trivial, otherwise a key-value pair whose key is the rewritten update expression, and value is the rewritten dataset; note that both the expression and dataset are rewritten only if necessary, reusing the supplied objects otherwise

      • matches

        private static boolean matches(URIPrefix prefix,
              org.openrdf.query.algebra.ValueConstant expr)
        Helper method that checks whether a URI prefix applies to the URI possibly associated to a ValueConstant.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the URI prefix
        expr - the ValueConstant expression
        Returns:
        true if match occurs

      • excludeCondition

        private static org.openrdf.query.algebra.ValueExpr excludeCondition(URIPrefix prefix,
                                                   Iterable<String> varNames)
        Helper method that returns a boolean condition enforcing that the values of all the supplied variables must not match the URI prefix specified (if values are URIs).
        Parameters:
        prefix - the URI prefix
        varNames - the names of the constrained variables
        Returns:
        the created algebraic expression

      • rewriteData

        @Nullable
private static org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr rewriteData(URIPrefix prefix,
                                                       boolean excludeDefault,
                                                       org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr expr,
                                                       @Nullable
                                                       Set<String> vars)
        Helper methods that rewrites the group pattern of an INSERT or DELETE clause, removing statement patterns addressing contexts whose URI matches the supplied or, optionally, in the default context. The group pattern must be composed exclusively of StatementPattern and Join nodes. In case it contains variables (not bound to a value), those variables are added to the set supplied with parameter vars, as it will be required to constrain their values in a WHERE clause in order to fully avoid writing to the specified graphs.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the URI prefix
        excludeDefault - true if statement patterns addressing the default graph must be removed
        expr - the group pattern to rewrite
        vars - a Set of variables populated with the variables (with unknown value) found in the group pattern
        Returns:
        the rewritten group pattern, null in case the original pattern is completely erased; note that the supplied group pattern is returned unchanged if no modification was necessary

      • rewriteProjection

        private static boolean rewriteProjection(URIPrefix prefix,
                        boolean excludeDefault,
                        org.openrdf.query.algebra.ProjectionElemList expr,
                        Map<String,org.openrdf.query.algebra.ValueExpr> extensions,
                        Set<String> vars)
